p: Essential oils (EOs) represent a major group of phytogenic feed additives (PFA) [ 15, 16, 32]. Due to their strong aromatic features and bioactivity, EOs have been widely used since ancient times in aromatherapy, as flavor and fragrances in cosmetics and foods, and more recently as pharmaceuticals, natural preservatives, additives, and biopesticides [ 33, 34, 35, 36]. The bioactivity of EOs depends on their complex mixture of volatile molecules produced by the secondary metabolism of aromatic and medical plants [ 25, 33].
